snippet: After operating shorthanded for its first two-week session in January, the Court of Appeals, the state’s highest court, begins a new one on Tuesday with judges in all seven of its seats.
abstract: New York State Court of Appeals begins new session with all seven seats filled; new appointees Judge Leslie E Stein and Judge Eugene M Fahey, both nominees of Gov Andrew Cuomo, tip court to a Democratic majority.
lead_paragraph: After operating shorthanded for its first two-week session in January, the Court of Appeals, the state’s highest court, begins a new one on Tuesday with judges in all seven of its seats.

headline.main: With Two New Judges, New York’s Court of Appeals Returns to Full Strength
headline.print_headline: Highest Court in New York Fills 2 Seats on the Bench
